title: Some properties of specific numbers
content: This section includes specific theorems about one-digit natural numbers (membership, addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, ordering).

blocks.name: neg1cn
blocks.content: -1 is a complex number. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 7-Jul-2016.)

blocks.name: neg1rr
blocks.content: -1 is a real number. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 5-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: neg1ne0
blocks.content: -1 is nonzero. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: neg1lt0
blocks.content: -1 is less than 0. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: negneg1e1
blocks.content: ` -u -u 1 ` is 1. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: 1pneg1e0
blocks.content: ` 1 + -u 1 ` is 0. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: 0m0e0
blocks.content: 0 minus 0 equals 0. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: 1m0e1
blocks.content: 1 - 0 = 1. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: 0p1e1
blocks.content: 0 + 1 = 1. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 7-Jul-2016.)

blocks.name: fv0p1e1
blocks.content: Function value at ` N + 1 ` with ` N ` replaced by ` 0 ` . Technical theorem to be used to reduce the size of a significant number of proofs. (Contributed by AV, 13-Aug-2022.)

blocks.name: 1p0e1
blocks.content: 1 + 0 = 1. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: 1p1e2
blocks.content: 1 + 1 = 2. (Contributed by NM, 1-Apr-2008.)

blocks.name: 2m1e1
blocks.content: 2 - 1 = 1. The result is on the right-hand-side to be consistent with similar proofs like ~ 4p4e8 . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 4-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: 1e2m1
blocks.content: 1 = 2 - 1. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: 3m1e2
blocks.content: 3 - 1 = 2. (Contributed by FL, 17-Oct-2010.) (Revised by NM, 10-Dec-2017.) (Proof shortened by AV, 6-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: 4m1e3
blocks.content: 4 - 1 = 3. (Contributed by AV, 8-Feb-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 6-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: 5m1e4
blocks.content: 5 - 1 = 4. (Contributed by AV, 6-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: 6m1e5
blocks.content: 6 - 1 = 5. (Contributed by AV, 6-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: 7m1e6
blocks.content: 7 - 1 = 6. (Contributed by AV, 6-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: 8m1e7
blocks.content: 8 - 1 = 7. (Contributed by AV, 6-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: 9m1e8
blocks.content: 9 - 1 = 8. (Contributed by AV, 6-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: 2p2e4
blocks.content: Two plus two equals four. For more information, see "2+2=4 Trivia" on the Metamath Proof Explorer Home Page: ~ mmset.html#trivia . This proof is simple, but it depends on many other proof steps because 2 and 4 are complex numbers and thus it depends on our construction of complex numbers. The proof ~ o2p2e4 is similar but proves ` 2 + 2 = 4 ` using ordinal natural numbers (finite integers starting at 0), so that proof depends on fewer intermediate steps. (Contributed by NM, 27-May-1999.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2p2e4() {
  |- wceq(co(nat2, caddc, nat2), nat4)
} = {
  eqtr4i(co(nat2, caddc, nat2), nat4, co(nat2, caddc, co(nat1, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat2, caddc, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))
  df-2()
  3eqtri(nat4, co(nat2, caddc, co(nat1, caddc, nat1)), co(nat3, caddc, nat1), co(co(nat2, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1))
  df-4()
  oveq1i(nat3, caddc, nat1, co(nat2, caddc, nat1))
  df-3()
  addassi(nat2, nat1, nat1)
  2cn()
  ax-1cn()
}

blocks.name: 2times
blocks.content: Two times a number. (Contributed by NM, 10-Oct-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-May-2016.) (Proof shortened by AV, 26-Feb-2020.)

blocks.name: times2
blocks.content: A number times 2. (Contributed by NM, 16-Oct-2007.)

blocks.name: 2timesi
blocks.content: Two times a number. (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-1999.)

blocks.name: times2i
blocks.content: A number times 2. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)

blocks.name: 2txmxeqx
blocks.content: Two times a complex number minus the number itself results in the number itself. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 8-Jun-2018.)

blocks.name: 2div2e1
blocks.content: 2 divided by 2 is 1. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: 2p1e3
blocks.content: 2 + 1 = 3. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: 1p2e3
blocks.content: 1 + 2 = 3. For a shorter proof using ~ addcomli , see ~ 1p2e3ALT . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by Steven Nguyen, 12-Dec-2022.)

blocks.name: 1p2e3ALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ 1p2e3 , shorter but using more axioms. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: 3p1e4
blocks.content: 3 + 1 = 4. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: 4p1e5
blocks.content: 4 + 1 = 5. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: 5p1e6
blocks.content: 5 + 1 = 6. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: 6p1e7
blocks.content: 6 + 1 = 7. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: 7p1e8
blocks.content: 7 + 1 = 8. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: 8p1e9
blocks.content: 8 + 1 = 9. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: 3p2e5
blocks.content: 3 + 2 = 5. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm 3p2e5() {
  |- wceq(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), nat5)
} = {
  eqtr4i(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), nat5, co(nat4, caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), co(nat4, caddc, nat1), co(co(nat3, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), co(co(nat3, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1), co(nat3, caddc, co(nat1, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat3, caddc, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))
  df-2()
  addassi(nat3, nat1, nat1)
  3cn()
  ax-1cn()
  oveq1i(nat4, caddc, nat1, co(nat3, caddc, nat1))
  df-4()
  df-5()
}

blocks.name: 3p3e6
blocks.content: 3 + 3 = 6. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm 3p3e6() {
  |- wceq(co(nat3, caddc, nat3), nat6)
} = {
  eqtr4i(co(nat3, caddc, nat3), nat6, co(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat3, caddc, nat3), co(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(nat3, caddc, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat3, caddc, nat3, co(nat2, caddc, nat1))
  df-3()
  addassi(nat3, nat2, nat1)
  3cn()
  2cn()
  ax-1cn()
  eqtr4i(nat6, co(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(nat5, caddc, nat1))
  df-6()
  oveq1i(co(nat3, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1, nat5)
  3p2e5()
}

blocks.name: 4p2e6
blocks.content: 4 + 2 = 6. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm 4p2e6() {
  |- wceq(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), nat6)
} = {
  eqtr4i(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), nat6, co(nat5, caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), co(nat5, caddc, nat1), co(co(nat4, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), co(co(nat4, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1), co(nat4, caddc, co(nat1, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat4, caddc, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))
  df-2()
  addassi(nat4, nat1, nat1)
  4cn()
  ax-1cn()
  oveq1i(nat5, caddc, nat1, co(nat4, caddc, nat1))
  df-5()
  df-6()
}

blocks.name: 4p3e7
blocks.content: 4 + 3 = 7. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm 4p3e7() {
  |- wceq(co(nat4, caddc, nat3), nat7)
} = {
  eqtr4i(co(nat4, caddc, nat3), nat7, co(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat4, caddc, nat3), co(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(nat4, caddc, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat4, caddc, nat3, co(nat2, caddc, nat1))
  df-3()
  addassi(nat4, nat2, nat1)
  4cn()
  2cn()
  ax-1cn()
  eqtr4i(nat7, co(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(nat6, caddc, nat1))
  df-7()
  oveq1i(co(nat4, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1, nat6)
  4p2e6()
}

blocks.name: 4p4e8
blocks.content: 4 + 4 = 8. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)

} = {

  eqtr4i(co(nat4, caddc, nat4), co(co(nat4, caddc, nat3), caddc, nat1), co(nat4, caddc, co(nat3, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat4, caddc, nat4, co(nat3, caddc, nat1))
  df-4()
  addassi(nat4, nat3, nat1)
  4cn()
  3cn()
  ax-1cn()
  eqtr4i(nat8, co(co(nat4, caddc, nat3), caddc, nat1), co(nat7, caddc, nat1))
  df-8()
  oveq1i(co(nat4, caddc, nat3), caddc, nat1, nat7)
  4p3e7()
}

blocks.name: 5p2e7

thm 5p2e7() {

} = {
  eqtr4i(co(nat5, caddc, nat2), nat7, co(nat6, caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat5, caddc, nat2), co(nat6, caddc, nat1), co(co(nat5, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1))
  eqtr4i(co(nat5, caddc, nat2), co(co(nat5, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1), co(nat5, caddc, co(nat1, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat5, caddc, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))
  df-2()
  addassi(nat5, nat1, nat1)
  5cn()
  ax-1cn()
  oveq1i(nat6, caddc, nat1, co(nat5, caddc, nat1))
  df-6()
  df-7()
}

blocks.name: 5p3e8
blocks.content: 5 + 3 = 8. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm 5p3e8() {

  eqtr4i(co(nat5, caddc, nat3), co(co(nat5, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(nat5, caddc, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat5, caddc, nat3, co(nat2, caddc, nat1))
  df-3()
  addassi(nat5, nat2, nat1)
  5cn()
  2cn()
  ax-1cn()
  eqtr4i(nat8, co(co(nat5, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(nat7, caddc, nat1))
  df-8()
  oveq1i(co(nat5, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1, nat7)
  5p2e7()
}

} = {

  df-4()
  addassi(nat5, nat3, nat1)
  5cn()
  3cn()
  ax-1cn()
  eqtr4i(nat9, co(co(nat5, caddc, nat3), caddc, nat1), co(nat8, caddc, nat1))

}

  df-2()
  addassi(nat6, nat1, nat1)

  df-8()
}

  df-3()
  addassi(nat6, nat2, nat1)
  6cn()

  ax-1cn()
  eqtr4i(nat9, co(co(nat6, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), co(nat8, caddc, nat1))

blocks.name: 7p2e9

blocks.origin:
thm 7p2e9() {

  eqtr4i(co(nat7, caddc, nat2), co(co(nat7, caddc, nat1), caddc, nat1), co(nat7, caddc, co(nat1, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat7, caddc, nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))
  df-2()
  addassi(nat7, nat1, nat1)

  df-8()
  df-9()
}

blocks.name: 1t1e1
blocks.content: 1 times 1 equals 1. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 7-Jul-2016.)

blocks.name: 2t1e2
blocks.content: 2 times 1 equals 2. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 6-Dec-2018.)

blocks.content: 2 times 2 equals 4. (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-1999.)

blocks.name: 3t3e9
blocks.content: 3 times 3 equals 9. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm 3t3e9() {
  |- wceq(co(nat3, cmul, nat3), nat9)
} = {
  eqtri(co(nat3, cmul, nat3), nat9, co(nat3, cmul, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq2i(nat3, cmul, nat3, co(nat2, caddc, nat1))
  df-3()
  eqtri(co(nat3, cmul, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)), nat9, co(nat6, caddc, nat3))
  eqtri(co(nat3, cmul, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)), co(nat6, caddc, nat3), co(co(nat3, cmul, nat2), caddc, co(nat3, cmul, nat1)))
  adddii(nat3, nat2, nat1)
  3cn()
  2cn()
  ax-1cn()
  oveq12i(co(nat3, cmul, nat2), caddc, co(nat3, cmul, nat1), nat6, nat3)
  3t2e6()
  3t1e3()
  6p3e9()
}

blocks.name: 1mhlfehlf
blocks.content: Prove that 1 - 1/2 = 1/2. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 4-Jan-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm 1mhlfehlf() {
  |- wceq(co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat2))
} = {
  3eqtr3ri(co(nat1, cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), co(co(nat2, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat2), co(co(nat2, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)))
  mp3an(wceq(co(co(nat2, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat2), co(co(nat2, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2))), wcel(nat2, cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wa(wcel(nat2, cc), wne(nat2, nat0)))
  2cn()
  ax-1cn()
  2cnne0()
  divsubdir(nat2, nat1, nat2)
  oveq1i(co(nat2, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat2, nat1)
  2m1e1()
  oveq1i(co(nat2, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), nat1)
  2div2e1()
}

blocks.name: 8th4div3
blocks.content: An eighth of four thirds is a sixth. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 24-Nov-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm 8th4div3() {
  |- wceq(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat8), cmul, co(nat4, cdiv, nat3)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat6))
} = {
  eqtri(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat8), cmul, co(nat4, cdiv, nat3)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat6), co(co(nat4, cmul, nat1), cdiv, co(nat4, cmul, nat6)))
  eqtri(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat8), cmul, co(nat4, cdiv, nat3)), co(co(nat4, cmul, nat1), cdiv, co(nat4, cmul, nat6)), co(co(nat1, cmul, nat4), cdiv, co(nat8, cmul, nat3)))
  divmuldivi(nat1, nat8, nat4, nat3)
  recni(nat8)
  gt0ne0ii(nat8)
  8re()
  8pos()
  3ne0()
  oveq12i(co(nat1, cmul, nat4), cdiv, co(nat8, cmul, nat3), co(nat4, cmul, nat1), co(nat4, cmul, nat6))
  mulcomi(nat1, nat4)
  eqtri(co(nat8, cmul, nat3), co(nat4, cmul, nat6), co(nat4, cmul, co(nat3, cmul, nat2)))
  eqtr3i(co(nat8, cmul, nat3), co(nat4, cmul, co(nat3, cmul, nat2)), co(co(nat4, cmul, nat3), cmul, nat2))
  eqtr3i(co(co(nat4, cmul, nat3), cmul, nat2), co(nat8, cmul, nat3), co(co(nat4, cmul, nat2), cmul, nat3))
  mul32i(nat4, nat2, nat3)
  oveq1i(co(nat4, cmul, nat2), cmul, nat3, nat8)
  4t2e8()
  mulassi(nat4, nat3, nat2)
  3cn()
  2cn()
  oveq2i(nat4, cmul, co(nat3, cmul, nat2), nat6)
  3t2e6()
  mp4an(wceq(co(co(nat4, cmul, nat1), cdiv, co(nat4, cmul, nat6)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), wcel(nat6, cc), wne(nat6, nat0), wcel(nat4, cc), wne(nat4, nat0))
  recni(nat6)
  gt0ne0ii(nat6)
  6re()
  6pos()
  4cn()
  4ne0()
  mp3an1(wa(wcel(nat6, cc), wne(nat6, nat0)), wa(wcel(nat4, cc), wne(nat4, nat0)), wceq(co(co(nat4, cmul, nat1), cdiv, co(nat4, cmul, nat6)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), wcel(nat1, cc))
  ax-1cn()
  divcan5(nat1, nat6, nat4)
}

blocks.name: halfpm6th
blocks.content: One half plus or minus one sixth. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Jan-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm halfpm6th() {
  |- wa(wceq(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat3)), wceq(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), caddc, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(nat2, cdiv, nat3)))
} = {
  pm3.2i(wceq(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat3)), wceq(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), caddc, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(nat2, cdiv, nat3)))
  3eqtr2i(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat3), co(co(nat3, cdiv, nat6), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(co(nat3, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat6))
  oveq1i(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6), co(nat3, cdiv, nat6))
  mp3an(wceq(co(co(nat3, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat6), co(co(nat3, cdiv, nat6), cmin, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6))), wcel(nat3, cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wa(wcel(nat6, cc), wne(nat6, nat0)))
  pm3.2i(wcel(nat6, cc), wne(nat6, nat0))
  divsubdir(nat3, nat1, nat6)
  3eqtr2i(co(co(nat3, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat6), co(nat1, cdiv, nat3), co(nat2, cdiv, nat6), co(co(nat1, cmul, nat2), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2)))
  oveq1i(co(nat3, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat6, nat2)
  3m1e2()
  oveq12i(co(nat1, cmul, nat2), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2), nat2, nat6)
  mulid2i(nat2)
  3eqtr3i(co(co(nat1, cmul, nat2), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat3), co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat3), cmul, co(nat2, cdiv, nat2)), co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat3), cmul, nat1))
  oveq2i(co(nat1, cdiv, nat3), cmul, co(nat2, cdiv, nat2), nat1)
  divmuldivi(nat1, nat3, nat2, nat2)
  mulid1i(co(nat1, cdiv, nat3))
  reccli(nat3)
  3eqtr2i(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), caddc, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(nat2, cdiv, nat3), co(nat4, cdiv, nat6), co(co(nat2, cmul, nat2), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2)))
  3eqtr4ri(co(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), caddc, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)), co(nat4, cdiv, nat6), co(co(nat3, caddc, nat1), cdiv, nat6), co(co(nat3, cdiv, nat6), caddc, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6)))
  divdiri(nat3, nat1, nat6)
  6cn()
  gt0ne0ii(nat6)
  6re()
  6pos()
  oveq1i(nat4, cdiv, nat6, co(nat3, caddc, nat1))
  df-4()
  oveq1i(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), caddc, co(nat1, cdiv, nat6), co(nat3, cdiv, nat6))
  3eqtr3i(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), co(nat3, cdiv, nat6), co(co(nat3, cdiv, nat3), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)), co(co(nat3, cmul, nat1), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2)))
  divmuldivi(nat3, nat3, nat1, nat2)
  ax-1cn()
  eqtri(co(co(nat3, cdiv, nat3), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)), co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), co(nat1, cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)))
  oveq1i(co(nat3, cdiv, nat3), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2), nat1)
  dividi(nat3)
  mulid2i(co(nat1, cdiv, nat2))
  halfcn()
  oveq12i(co(nat3, cmul, nat1), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2), nat3, nat6)
  mulid1i(nat3)
  oveq12i(co(nat2, cmul, nat2), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2), nat4, nat6)
  2t2e4()
  3t2e6()
  3eqtr3i(co(co(nat2, cmul, nat2), cdiv, co(nat3, cmul, nat2)), co(nat2, cdiv, nat3), co(co(nat2, cdiv, nat3), cmul, co(nat2, cdiv, nat2)), co(co(nat2, cdiv, nat3), cmul, nat1))
  oveq2i(co(nat2, cdiv, nat3), cmul, co(nat2, cdiv, nat2), nat1)
  dividi(nat2)
  divmuldivi(nat2, nat3, nat2, nat2)
  2ne0()
  mulid1i(co(nat2, cdiv, nat3))
  divcli(nat2, nat3)
  2cn()
  3cn()
  3ne0()
}
